label: Predictive Analytics Platform
description: Accelerates model development dramatically with AutoML, continuous deployment, real-time predictions, and auto-retraining when drift detected.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual model building by data scientists with sporadic deployment and no monitoring resulting in long time-to-value and degrading accuracy.
painPoints: Weeks to months for model development
Batch predictions limit real-time use cases
Model drift not detected, degrading accuracy over time
Limited data science capacity constrains ML adoption
constraints: Manual model building takes weeks to months
Sporadic deployment creates long time-to-value
Batch predictions limit real-time use cases
Model drift not detected, degrading accuracy over time
Limited data science capacity constrains ML adoption
No systematic model lifecycle management

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers struggle with sudden demand surges during flash sales or viral social media trends, leading to stock-outs of trending items while overstocking slow-moving inventory. (Source: McKinsey Retail Report 2023)
Manual price optimization models take months to build, missing dynamic competitor pricing and revenue management opportunities.

Grocery retailers struggle with forecasting demand for perishable items, leading to 20-30% waste of fresh produce and dairy products due to inaccurate shelf-life predictions. (Source: USDA Economic Research Report)
QSR operators cannot monitor real-time drive-thru wait times across locations, leading to customer abandonment and reduced throughput during peak hours. (Source: QSR Magazine Operations Report)

agenticApproach.description: Models built dramatically faster, deployed continuously, real-time predictions, auto-retraining when drift detected enabling ML at scale.
benefits: Dramatically faster model development vs manual
Continuous deployment vs sporadic manual releases
Significant increase in models in production
Democratized ML beyond data science team

contextualBenefits.content: Real-time demand forecasting enables just-in-time inventory, reducing stock-outs by 40% and overstock by 30% during seasonal peaks.

Airlines and hotels can adjust pricing in real-time based on demand patterns, competitor actions, and external factors like weather or events, increasing revenue by 3-8% through optimal yield management. (Source: IATA Aviation Economics Report)

Hotels can monitor real-time booking patterns and adjust pricing dynamically, maximizing revenue per available room (RevPAR) through last-minute rate optimization. (Source: STR Global Hospitality Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AutoML automating feature engineering, model selection, and hyperparameter tuning']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on self-service ML platform enabling business analysts and accelerated development cycles']

quickWins: Deploy AutoML platform for pilot use case (churn, demand forecast)
Implement model monitoring for top 3 production models
Enable real-time prediction serving for customer-facing use cases
prerequisites: ML platform (DataRobot, H2O.ai, Databricks AutoML, or AWS SageMaker)
MLflow or similar for model lifecycle management
Model serving infrastructure (SageMaker, Vertex AI, or Seldon)
Monitoring platform for model performance tracking
Clean training data with defined prediction targets

activities: Select and deploy AutoML platform (DataRobot, H2O.ai, or SageMaker)
Identify 2-3 high-impact use cases (churn prediction, demand forecasting)
Build initial ML models using AutoML with data science team oversight
Establish model monitoring for accuracy and drift detection
Create basic model deployment pipeline for batch predictions
outcomes: 2-3 production ML models deployed with monitoring
20-40% improvement in prediction accuracy vs manual models
Established ML governance and deployment processes
Data science team trained on AutoML platform
Initial ROI demonstrated for executive buy-in
prerequisites: Clean, labeled training data available
Data science team with basic ML knowledge
Cloud infrastructure for model training and serving
Executive sponsorship for ML initiative

activities: Expand to 10+ ML models across multiple business domains
Create self-service ML capabilities for business analysts
Establish ML model catalog and governance framework
Integrate ML predictions into operational workflows
outcomes: 10+ ML models in production with automated lifecycle management
Real-time predictions integrated into customer-facing applications
50-70% reduction in time from idea to production model
Business analysts can build simple models independently
ML becomes core competency with dedicated team and processes
Measurable business impact across multiple KPIs
prerequisites: Successful pilot models from Crawl phase
Expanded data science team or ML engineering resources
Real-time data pipelines and serving infrastructure
Integration capabilities with existing business systems

activities: Scale to 50+ ML models across enterprise
Implement advanced ML techniques (deep learning, ensemble methods)
Create ML platform for citizen data scientists
Establish continuous learning from all data sources
Integrate AI agents for autonomous model optimization
Develop predictive analytics for strategic decision-making
outcomes: 50+ ML models driving autonomous business decisions
AI agents continuously optimizing model performance
Predictive analytics embedded in all major business processes
80-90% of analytical needs met through self-service ML
ML innovation lab driving next-generation capabilities
Industry-leading AI maturity with competitive advantage
prerequisites: Mature ML platform and processes from Walk phase
Advanced data science and ML engineering team
Enterprise-wide data strategy and governance
Executive commitment to AI transformation
Integration with strategic planning and innovation processes

keyTechnologyPartners.name: DataRobot
keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: End-to-end ML lifecycle management from data prep to model deployment

keyTechnologyPartners.name: H2O.ai

label: Marketing Attribution Modeling
description: Provides data-driven attribution with incrementality measurement, optimized budget allocation, and undisputed ROI metrics.

traditionalApproach.description: Last-click attribution only with duplicate credit claims and disputed ROI resulting in suboptimal budget allocation.
constraints: Last-click attribution undervalues upper-funnel channels
Channels claim duplicate credit (sum of ROI > 100%)
No cross-channel customer journey visibility
Budget allocation based on disputed metrics
Manual analysis takes weeks per campaign
No true incrementality measurement

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot accurately measure the impact of social media ads, email campaigns, and in-store experiences on final purchases, leading to inefficient budget allocation across marketing channels. (Source: Gartner Retail Marketing Report)

agenticApproach.description: Data-driven attribution model with incrementality measured, budget optimized, and undisputed ROI metrics achieving improved marketing efficiency.
characteristics: Multi-touch attribution using algorithmic models (linear, time-decay, data-driven)
Incrementality testing via geo-holdout experiments measures true lift
Budget allocation agent recommends optimal spend across channels
Attribution reporting generates channel performance dashboards
Continuous model refinement from new data

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can better understand the true value of different booking channels (direct vs. OTAs), optimizing commission structures and reducing dependency on high-commission third-party platforms. (Source: Phocuswright Travel Technology Report)

projections.metric: Marketing ROI Improvement from Budget Optimization
projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on data-driven attribution reallocating spend from low-performing to high-performing channels']

quickWins: Deploy multi-touch attribution for digital channels
Run geo-holdout test for top spending channel
Implement budget optimization for paid media mix
prerequisites: Attribution platform (Rockerbox, Neustar, Google Analytics 4)
Cross-channel marketing data aggregation
Experimentation framework for incrementality tests
BI tool for attribution reporting
Defined conversion events and customer journey

label: Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM)
description: Delivers continuous MMM refresh with instant scenario testing, automated recommendations, and integrated planning achieving significant media efficiency improvement.

traditionalApproach.description: Annual econometric modeling by consultants with static recommendations becoming quickly outdated.
constraints: Annual refresh too infrequent for dynamic markets
External consultants expensive and slow
Static recommendations become outdated
No integration with marketing planning workflows
Limited to historical macro analysis
No scenario testing capability

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot measure how promotions in one channel (e.g., online flash sales) impact sales in other channels (e.g., physical stores), leading to suboptimal promotional strategies. (Source: Nielsen Retail Effectiveness Report)

agenticApproach.description: MMM refreshed continuously with scenarios tested instantly, recommendations automated, and planning integrated achieving media efficiency improvement.
characteristics: Econometric modeling builds MMM continuously (weekly/monthly refresh)
Scenario planning simulates budget scenarios and predicts outcomes
External factor agent incorporates seasonality, competitors, economy
Optimization agent recommends optimal media mix for goals
benefits: Continuous MMM refresh vs annual static model
Instant scenario testing vs weeks of consultant analysis

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can optimize marketing spend across peak and shoulder seasons, understanding how different campaign types perform during various demand periods. (Source: Skift Travel Marketing Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on continuous model refresh enabling real-time optimization and scenario-based budget allocation']

quickWins: Deploy MMM platform with monthly model refresh
Implement scenario planning for annual media planning
Enable self-service scenario testing for marketing team
prerequisites: Statistical modeling platform (R, Python with econometric libraries)
Data warehouse with marketing spend and sales data (24+ months)
External factor data (weather, competitors, economic indicators)
Scenario planning tool or custom build
Visualization platform for insights distribution

label: Churn Prediction & Prevention
description: Identifies at-risk customers with early warning enabling personalized interventions that significantly reduce churn.

traditionalApproach.description: Reactive churn analysis after customers leave with generic retention offers having low success rates.
constraints: Reactive approach misses prevention opportunity
No early warning of at-risk customers
Generic retention offers poorly targeted
Win-back campaigns have low success rates
No understanding of churn reasons
Revenue loss before intervention

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers lose customers from loyalty programs due to irrelevant offers and poor personalization, with 40% of enrolled members becoming inactive within 12 months. (Source: Bond Loyalty Report)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Customer retention campaign effectiveness benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: At-risk customers identified early with personalized interventions significantly reducing churn through proactive prevention.
characteristics: Churn risk scoring predicts individual churn probability
Reason detection identifies likely churn drivers (service, price, competition)
Retention strategy agent selects optimal tactic per customer
Intervention orchestration triggers proactive outreach, offers, service recovery
benefits: Significant churn reduction through proactive retention
Higher ROI on retention spend vs win-back

contextualBenefits.content: Airlines and hotels can identify customers likely to cancel bookings and offer proactive rebooking assistance or incentives, reducing no-show rates by 15-25%. (Source: Airlines for America Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML model detecting behavioral signals (engagement decline, support contacts) before churn decision']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on proactive intervention with personalized retention tactics before customer decides to leave']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on proactive prevention being more cost-effective than reactive win-back campaigns']

quickWins: Deploy churn prediction model for subscription customers
Implement automated retention campaigns for high-risk segment
Enable reason detection from support and behavior data
prerequisites: ML platform for churn model training and scoring
Customer Data Platform with unified profiles
Campaign automation for retention workflows
Historical churn data with customer attributes
Support, billing, and engagement data for reason detection

label: Demand Forecasting & Sensing
description: Achieves high forecast accuracy with ML models, external signal integration, and faster consensus achieving inventory cost reduction.

traditionalApproach.description: Monthly historical forecasts with moderate accuracy causing stock-outs and overstock.
constraints: Historical-only forecasts miss market signals
Manual promotion adjustments error-prone
No external data integration (weather, trends, social)
Moderate accuracy causes stock-outs and overstock
Monthly cycles too slow for dynamic demand
Judgmental overrides not systematic

contextualConstraints.content: Grocery retailers struggle with forecasting demand for perishable items, leading to 20-30% waste of fresh produce and dairy products due to inaccurate shelf-life predictions. (Source: USDA Economic Research Report)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Retail demand forecasting accuracy benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: High forecast accuracy with external signals incorporated, promotions predicted accurately, and consensus achieved faster reducing inventory costs.
characteristics: Statistical forecasting uses time-series models (ARIMA, Prophet, LSTM)
External signal agent integrates weather, trends, social sentiment, economics
Promotional impact agent uses ML models for promotion lift
Consensus agent combines statistical and judgmental forecasts optimally
benefits: High forecast accuracy vs moderate traditional
External signals improve responsiveness to market changes
Promotional lift predicted accurately (vs manual guesses)
Consensus achieved faster with systematic combination

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can predict demand spikes from major events, conferences, or holidays, enabling proactive capacity adjustments and dynamic pricing. (Source: World Travel & Tourism Council Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML time-series models and external signal integration improving demand sensing']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on improved accuracy reducing deviation between forecast and actual demand']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on better forecast accuracy reducing safety stock requirements and overstock situations']

quickWins: Deploy ML forecasting for top 20% of SKUs by revenue
Integrate external signals (weather, holidays) for seasonal categories
Implement promotional lift models for planned promotions
prerequisites: Forecasting platform (Anaplan, o9 Solutions, Blue Yonder, or custom)
Historical sales data (24+ months) with causal factors
External data APIs (weather, economic indicators, social trends)
ML models for time-series and promotional impact
Collaboration tool for forecast consensus

label: Real-Time Dashboards & Alerts
description: Delivers real-time dashboards with intelligent alerts achieving dramatic noise reduction, automated root cause analysis, and actionable insights.

traditionalApproach.description: Static dashboards refreshed nightly with simple threshold alerts and manual analysis resulting in delayed issue detection and alert fatigue.
constraints: Nightly refresh means issues discovered too late
Simple thresholds create alert fatigue (false positives)
No context for why anomalies occurred
Dashboard sprawl reduces usability
Manual drill-down takes hours to days
Reactive vs proactive issue detection

contextualConstraints.content: QSR operators cannot monitor real-time drive-thru wait times across locations, leading to customer abandonment and reduced throughput during peak hours. (Source: QSR Magazine Operations Report)

agenticApproach.description: Real-time dashboards with intelligent alerts achieving dramatic noise reduction, root causes identified automatically, and actionable insights.
characteristics: Metric monitoring tracks all KPIs in real-time
Anomaly detection uses ML to identify unusual patterns
Root cause analysis automatically investigates anomalies
Smart alerting reduces noise, escalates correctly, suggests actions
Unified analytics workspace vs dashboard sprawl
benefits: Real-time visibility vs nightly batch updates
Dramatic alert noise reduction through intelligent detection
Automated root cause analysis vs manual investigation
Significant time saved on manual analysis
Proactive issue detection vs reactive discovery

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML anomaly detection filtering false positives and smart alerting escalating only actionable issues']

quickWins: Deploy anomaly detection for top 10 business KPIs
Implement smart alerting to reduce alert fatigue
Enable automated root cause analysis for critical metrics
prerequisites: BI platform with real-time capabilities (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Streaming analytics for real-time data processing
Anomaly detection engine (commercial or open source)
Alert routing and escalation infrastructure
Defined KPIs and business logic for root cause analysis
